result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian P. Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

probation revocation packet
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 10:13 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Alex Lech in person. Defendant appears in person, with Atty Heather Roehr for Atty Adam Fontana.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.


State moves to;
CT 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs - 2nd and subsequent - Repeater)>>AMEND TO: delete repeater enhancer.
COURT grants above.
PLEA: 
CT 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs - 2nd and subsequent)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA; No possession of controlled substances; Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol/controlled substances, unless prescribed and taken as prescribed; 6 monts in MCJ I/S for rule violations; CC plus DNA surcharge; DNA sample; 7 days credit if revoked. 

Adjourned: 10:23 a.m.
